intro: Secamone stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf secamone, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small, clustered in dense inflorescences, and typically have five petals. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
